name: Crossfader
description: This algorithm crossfades between two or more sets of signals (from mono up to sets of eight channels). When crossfading between more than two sets of signals, it behaves like a ‘scanning’ or ‘morphing’ mixer. Three different crossfade curves are available: **Equal gain** - appropriate for phase-coherent material; **Equal power** - suitable for non-phase-coherent material; and **Transition** - DJ-style crossfade where both sources are at full gain at the 50% position. Inputs A to L, and the output, use a contiguous range of busses starting with the one set via parameters, with channel count determined by the ‘Width’ parameter.
gui_description: The display shows a graphical representation of the crossfade curves, illustrating the amount of each input signal in the output mix.

parameters.description: The crossfade curve type: 0 = Equal gain, 1 = Equal power, 2 = Transition (DJ-style).
